column4: Does anyone know how to go about debugging my problem of "ethernet stopped working when I upgraded to Breezy"?
One idea is to downgrade to Hoary...
Another is to figure out what the modern syntax is to pass irq options to kernel modules...
you could always recompile your kernel...
I'm using the standard Ubuntu kernel.
sorry, thought you had a working boot
Yes, it boots.  Everything works fine except no network.
so how is the nic different?
that's the thing -- this is the same machine, same nic, etc., that worked with Hoary.
ok so what modules was in use by hoary and are there any errors in dmesg?
there are no errors.  Unfortunately I do not have extant logs from Hoary.
what does lspci show for your nic
lspci agrees with /proc/interrupts -- my eth card is using IRQ 23.
any chance of changing the irq for the nic in the bios and sidestepping the problem altogether?
I've already tried 50 different combinations of BIOS settings and passing pci=routeirq or not.
watch it be the patch cable... ;)
especially if you can lsmod the driver and ping the interface
